>game heavily borrows from PLA

It really makes you think.
PLA should be the base moving forward.
Make buffs and statuses work like normal. (Maybe bring Drowsy in and change some sleep moves, and definitely bring in Frostbite and change almost all Freeze ice moves to that.)
But the best change to bring over is the change to the battle system. Speed is no longer the god stat and just determines how fast you can go. Agile-Strong patches up so many weak coverage moves (like the elemental bites) into ones that are pretty decent (60BP to 90BP).
And most everyone would prefer the ability to catch without battling mons that are "peaceful" to "timid". It just makes them feel more real when only the asshole mons force a battle on you. (By that same token, nerf catch XP.)

That's a good idea, but you also need to be submitting stuff in the right s14 cell. If that gym across from him is in the same cell, then he's going to need to get at least four more stops up. Read this:

https://pokemongohub.net/post/article/comprehensive-guide-s2-cells-pokemon-go/#:~:text=Pok%C3%A9mon%20GO%20is%20built%20on%20top%20of%20S2,translate%20Earth%E2%80%99s%20spherical%203D%20shape%20into%202D%20geometry.

Then use:

https://www.pogomap.info/

To check where the cells line up in your are, you can go into settings on the map and choose either level 17 or 14 cells. Also, using the Ingress Intel Map can be useful as well as it shows all POIs, even ones that didn't make it into Go.

>What is it?
https://www.pokeclicker.com/
Pokéclicker is an open-source game built around the story and content of the Pokémon games. This is an idle & clicker type game that is currently in beta release phase. New content and patches are released frequently.

>Crobat?
https://crobat4.github.io/pokeclicker/
A modified version of Pokeclicker that features QoL changes from the original, including a Dock shortcut, type-based pokeball selection, Gen 3+ berries being available in dungeons, un-nerfed experience gains, and some egg-exclusive pokemon being available through other means.

posts.com:
I think the main reason is that it had a headstart. I believe that gave it a major advantage on top of the pokedex description. But in general there's a few things that people find attractive in Pokémon design.

If we look at a wider picture we can see some of that in the data we have avaliable. Here for example is three different polls, the 4chan post is the smash percent ranked by number and the others is rule34.xxx and Tiermaker. The numbers on the right represent NSFW growth in the span of four months so you can divide that by 4 to get a rough NSFW per month number.

If we look at data there's Pokémon that are consistent in high placements AND also in getting a good number of NSFW art. Gardevoir, Lopunny, the eeveelutions with emphasis on Umbreon, Vaporeon and Sylveon, Braixen and to a lesser extend Delphox, and Zoroark.

Most of these are feminine designs and/or had a feminine portrayal like Zoroark in it's movie, which likely helped it a lot in this context, most are also cute. So cute and feminine designs seem to be what people like in Pokémon character design. Of course other factors like portrayal and popularity help, as in the case of Gardevoir and Lucario and to a lesser extent Zoroark, in the main series and also being seen as a legacy character like Lopunny. I also think the eeveelutions show that bodyshape isn't as big of a factor due to how ubiquitous they are in this context and even more so when you factor in how they're becoming more integrated into the mainstream perception of pokephilia.

>>53120393
They're both Pokémon which is, as far as I can tell, enough for most people. I will state as I've done many times that one can't ignore the context Pokémon find themselves in, in the series there's no distinction made between Pokémon for the most part. The series is far more concerned with the way they're portrayed and the series makers want a uniformed portrayal of them hence why the guidelines from the 2012 guide and what we know of the Detective Pikachu filmmakers working with The Pokémon Company.

Because of this, in my opinion, Pokémon attraction has a pretty unique context which extends to the way people perceive Pokémon and the way these results manifest themselves.

It's why I like using that "horsemen of the apocalypse" tweet with Vaporeon, Gardevoir, Lucario and Lopunny because it shows there is a consciousness on which Pokémon are sexualized and which exist in the forefront of Pokephilia. I think far more telling is how widespread the Vaporeon copypasta is, in public nsfw subreddits people constantly post it in Pokémon post that get traction including Gardevoir, and they also like the tiktok meme with Batman and Joker. YouTube channels like Sum and Pokemon Drunk Oak cycle through the same Pokémon and that includes the eeveelutions especially in the case of Sum. These are channels with a wide audience for what they create. The latest viralish video, furrymon, had a rapping vaporeon on the cover.

Eeveelution attraction has always been present, Sylveon, Glaceon and Umbreon attest to that, but the vaporeon pasta gave it a face to rally around. It's become so entrenched that Vaporeon can challenge established Pokémon in general spaces like Vaporeon taking the spot of the most upvoted picture from Gardevoir in rule34.

This is also acknowledged by the anime staff.
https://youtu.be/DuItIoZKghw
The choice of Glaceon is very deliberate, it may not be Vaporeon but it predates the blow up of the meme, they could have put Tsareena but didn't.

>>53120655
That's your own perception which is fine. But we're talking about in a wider picture and what is the perception of people in a general sense. As I mentioned it's something that's acknowledged in the popular imagination. Tweets like this
https://mobile.twitter.com/PokemonHttps/status/1599134562214608896
And just the Pokémon people harken in general in a pokephilia context show that Vaporeon is a Pokémon know to people in this context. The Biz video with the uncanny Mr. Incredible shows how well know it is as an example.

On the way the series works there's nothing to draw on for a distinction because of the way the series is constructed. The Pokémon franchise doesn't divide Pokémon in that sort of way so people have no reason to either especially since the series likes to treat Pokémon as a collective. Indeed I wanted to expand on my last point with the Meowth scene. They specifically used an eeveelution there. They could've used Medicham for a Team Charm reference, they could have gone with purrloin, or since it was gen 7 even salazzle or tsareena yet they did not. As the data shows the eeveelutions are a ubiquitous part of Pokémon attraction, scoring very high and being to object of sexualizition even before factoring in the widespread nature of the Vaporeon copypasta. And speaking of that I've shown how it can manifest in NSFW context with it allowing Vaporeon to reach a more "normal" status, in truth I think there's more of an acknowledgement of pokephilia rather than attraction to the concept, to the point that it can even challenge Gardevoir in general nsfw spaces. In SFW space it's also very widespread.

In short while you have your own opinions one can't ignore how tied the eeveelutions are to the concept of Pokephilia. From general perception to material being made to even "official" acknowledgement. In the popular imagination Pokémon like Gardevoir, Lopunny and Vaporeon are interchangeable when it comes to the front face of pokephilia.

Gardevoir's body is sort of fake.
It is in both the amorphous and human-like egg-groups, in spite of being one of the most anthropomorphic of nearly any Pokemon.
I reckon it was previously a far more inhuman form previously, akin to something like Reiniculus or Mismagius.
However, it has attained a shape which is human-like to aid in its relating to humans. Human's are more likely to trust something as serene and familiar as a Gardevoir or Kirlia, than they are a floating blob.
For instance, its legs are more or less fake. It moves through levitation, and the limbs are far too spindly to support its weight.
Ralt's design is also far less humanoid, having a torso and legs which fuse into each other with a trailing portion, as if it is not experienced enough to maintain sufficiently humanoid extremities.
It's real body seems to be the head(Which remains similarly sized through each evolution), and the horn/heart through which it uses its powers.
Why it is so interested in humans is up to interpretation.
However, the line is intrinsically involved with humanity somehow, with Kirlia evolving due to contact with a humans positive emotions, and the noted protectivity of a Gardevoir towards its trainer (The pokedex stresses that this is towards its trainer, not merely just its loved ones)
Any thoughts why?

>>53125332
Japan doesn’t care about murder or really most nudity for that matter. They just have a strict attitude about showing any sort of physically intimate relationship between two people onscreen. I don’t know if it’s an actual legal thing or more of just a cultural attitude. For example, in the 30 live-action Godzilla films produced by Toho, there is literally only one kiss that happens mostly offscreen, and is only shown in a panning shot as the man and woman pull away from each other. I couldn’t find a clip of it on YouTube, but it’s between American actor Nick Adams and Japanese actress Kumi Mizuno in Invasion of Astro-Monster from 1966. This is Japan’s biggest, most long-running film franchise, and is one of the IPs that inspired Pokémon.

>>53123275
>but why 6 months? is there a specific timeframe or what?
there's a reason /vp/ixelmon starts sometime in spring and ends in august/september
having the server up for a limited amount of months forces players to actually value their time on the server instead of just mindlessly wandering the map/hiding in a corner like a hermit
it instead motivates people to leave a mark on the server, take the opportunity to interact with their fellow players, and do stuff while they still can
however the server will stay up for long enough each generation for there to be more than enough time to accomplish everything you plan on doing (making cool builds, getting all the badges to asset dominance over plebs, catching 'em all even though rule 5 is never enforced, etc) before everyone gets burnt out, assuming the server isn't terribly managed like last gen

>and do we get to suggest other mods?
assuming the host isn't a faggot like 2022 /vp/ixelmon
then probably yes

And this is just one example of many. Ponder what the government will do, once these filters have been tested against every loophole an infinite army of free beta testers have put them through. Speaking in coded language? Spotted. Using metaphors to convey ideas? Tagged. Talking as if you're happy, but accidentally giving away subtle cues in your word choice that you are now 0.3% more likely to take action against the government than you were the day before? Flagged and Bagged, you unpatriotic scum.

It is indeed Terror, of the highest caliber, once you begin to see the scope at which these devices will eventually operate at. Because it's not a conspiracy theory, this is all right out in the open, and it's proceeding forward at an incredible rate. Just look how much buzz there's been about AI art and AI chat in the past 6 months.

Explosive.

The singularity is coming, and it will be gatekept and shackled. And we will not be invited.

posts.name: Writefuck
posts.com:
Time for my threadly plug for the VN I'm writing. Hang out with Cynthia in Olivine City and solve crimes! Also featuring Jasmine. It's completely free.

writefuck.itch.io/olivinelights

>What's new?

Mostly finished writing a sidequest with Jasmine. It took a little while due to some writers' block, but it's in a good place. I've implemented some achievements (picrel) which primarily are there so the player/reader knows what content has and hasn't been seen yet. Achievements will be persistent between playthroughs and some of them also unlock things in an "extras" menu that will include things like showing your cynthia_love and jasmine_love stats, or starting off with your pokemon evolved. This will probably all be available in the next major update, but...

I'm having a hard time commissioning actual art for this for some reason. I need several SFW CG's and a whole bunch of NSFW ones, and I have plenty of money to throw at some artists, but out of everyone I PM'd or DM'd, almost no one has even answered me. Maybe I'm just being impatient, I dunno. I need a better way to recruit artists than just cold calling randos. I wish I had artist friends.

I'm getting increasingly uncomfortable with the fact that the VN contains art that's completely stolen from pixiv or deviantart and used without permission. My priority for commissioning CG's is to replace all the stolen art with paid art that I have permission to use. I might open up a ko-fi or something after I've done that. I won't put this behind a paywall, but I won't decline donations once I'm not using stolen art anymore. I'm not worried about official art or sprites stolen from Nintendo since I'm using their IP anyway, and I'm pretty sure I'm covered under fair use doctrine regardless. I just don't feel right stealing art from random strangers even though I'm not making money off of it. I might hold off on releasing another update until I have new art to replace the stolen assets. Not sure.

inb4 "just use AI"

>>53101880
Pao is absolutely broken, more than Chi-Yu ever was.
It outspeeds EVERYTHING except Dragapult which is weak to both its priority STABs for starters.
Tera Band Crunch 2HKOs at worst everything in the tier including resists, so absolutely nothing but certain scarfers, priority users or strategic Terastal mons can check it.
Tera Blast Electric beats all of its "checks" if you run HDB.
It's not that squishy either, 80/80 physical bulk is respectable.
Its defensive type is not that useless, it has key resistances that can be exploited.
Pao is a premier wallbreaker, revenge killer and sweeper all rolled into one. No other offensive mon in the tier can compress all offensive roles in a single set and excel at all of them at once.
Chi-Yu is a nuke, but 100 base speed means it either wallbreaks or runs scarf and Overheat can't be spammed as much as Pao's STABs, plus it has no priority.

posts.com:
Bored out of my mind and it wandred to comp, so I'm gonn type out some changes I'd make to the past 3 generational gimmicks if they're ever to return in an official capacity
>Megas
The stats gained now scale with the initial BST of the mon. For example, if a mon had less than, say, 500 BST, they'd get the full 100 BST boost, but if they had 600 BST, they'd get a heavily reduced BST bump of only around 10. This forces the already "strong" Pokemon getting Megas to take those optimal stats from an actual place they'd miss then rather than becoming nonsensical statblobs. If Mega Metgross still want its' 145 attack, 105 special attack, and 110 speed, it'll have to eat into it's HP, Defense, and Special Defense to do so even with the points afforded to it, whereas Megas like Audino and Sableye won't have to suffer. This also further pushes the "Megas as an alternative rather than straight updgrade" angle Kalosfags desperately want you to believe applied for more than a small handful of them.
>Z-Moves
When a Pokemon holding a Z-Crystal swaps in, the type of cystal it's holding is announced. For example, you swap Heatran holding a Grassium-Z in and the text "Heatran is a giving off an intensely verdant aura!" shows with an accompanying visual.
>Dynamax
Max HP bonus goes from 2x to 1.5x, ALL stat boosting Max Moves are capped to 100 BP in the BEST case, and Gmaxes are now given the option to use their Gmax moves alongside normal Max Moves. After they Gmax, another prompt like the initial DMax one shows up with a new symbol. Selecting it will allow you to hen use the Gmax move for the corresponding type of move that turn However, you can only do this ONCE. This change is gonna require a mass rebalancing of G-Max moves overall (the Kanto trio's moves literally only need to be used once to get max value in their current state, so cut their duration down to 4 turns, for example), but I think it'd be overall healthier.
Thoughts?

I was sitting and thinking about what kind of dragon you could bring to a trick room team since most dragons are just so fast and it kind of struck me.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>53123758
The only type weak to both Fire and Ice is Grass. It'd still be weak to Flying, Bug, and Poison in that case. You could use it to add resistances to an already decent defensive type, but most defensive Teras are into Steel or Water, and they both resist Ice while Water also resists Fire.

Turning it into a Flying type could be a decent idea. It'd only be weak to Electric and Rock, it'd resist Fighting, Bug, Grass, and Fire, and it'd be immune to Ground. Steel resists/is immune to all the types that are SE against Appletun, so that's an obvious choice, but it makes the Ice resist from Thick Fat rather redundant. You could honestly make good use of a Ripen set with one of the boost berries to get a +2 stat boost if it were Steel type.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>53124134
Appletun makes do with Leech Seed. It's just not that threatening of a Pokemon with base 100 SpA. It could use +10 to Def, SpD, and SpA. It'd be a genuine threat in the middle tiers if that were to happen, since it'd have the bulk to back up its Leech Seed recovery and enough SpA to threaten out more defensive Pokemon, especially with Apple Acid lowering their SpD.

>>53125130
Band needs icicle spinner/crash + crunch + sacred sword or else it doesn't work as well. Ice moves are needed for pokemon like great tusk, dragonite, and all the tera faries out there. If you don't run that stab you'll be giving them free turns which can lose you the game. Psychic fangs won't ohko great tusk and tera fairy skeledirge (if defensive) for example will be impossible to beat without your ice moves. Sacred sword is needed for Kingambit and most importantly opposing Chien Paos. Then you've got that last slot which you can give to psychic fangs but then you lose priority moves which means you lose to things like dragapult and boosted valiant. You can definitely run it if you really want to lure Tauros but there's a big cost to that

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>53103298
You can usually add parenthesis around a term in your prompt to emphasize it, and brackets to decrease the importance of a term. So the previous “cute, grey cat” might look like “[cute],((grey cat)). Also, copy the exact tags as used on danbooru such as: may (pokemon). just look it up in the internet, there's plenty of good tutorials out there atm

>>53115808
I'm a graphic designer / artist / web developer who likes to be be creative during his free time, but I never really had the time or energy to really excel at drawing / game design or writing, though I had tons of passion and ideas. Last year Stable Diffusion released and I felt I had to stay up to date with the recent tech, since all these ai's can and will eventually influence my job. Instead of fighting it I feel like I should learn to use it to my advantage, since there's no way we're stopping it.

Apart from all that, it's fun. I can make my own reference material, try different styles, play with coloring or shading without having to spend hours upon hours of learning. Drawing a nice piece used to take weeks, and now I can combine the notorious 'soulless' ai art with my own skills and style and make something great, in a matter of hours. Back in the day you had to buy the newspaper in order to read the news, now you can take your phone out of your pocket, this is the same thing.

Oh, and also... infinite amount of great waifu art anon

>>53116747
because the vast majority of all human artists suck at hands. The ai does not think for itself, it's trained on their pics. It simply takes over their mistakes. It's also why the ai likes to get rid of hands in its pics (pic related), artists do that a lot. Hands, feet and eyes are the most common ai problems atm, since they're also the most common problems humans experience while drawing. This also means that if more people start to draw hands, feet and eyes to fix the ai's mistakes, in time the ai will become better at these things as well.

OP here, i use novelai, so all processing happens on their server. Any laptop / computer can do that. Its still possible if you want to run it locally, but your generations will take longer, ranging from a few seconds to a full minute. Its not very hard to learn if you keep experimenting. I'm not at home right now, otherwise I could show you my progress the past couple months, but I'll post it later today when I'm back. By now there's plenty of tutorials and guides. Novelai is easier since you have to tweak less stuff to make something nice, but yeah, its also a paid subscription.

To all people posting images, I'll be back tonight to do your requests, if thread's still up, otherwise I'll post them in the next thread

posts.name: cge0361
posts.com:
>>53104595
>otherwise a skin flap that can peel down
The executive producer for Love Lost once drew a sketch page on that topic (don't ask, I got tired of carrying random image clutter years ago) but I've tried to avoid giving pokemon mammary glands. Miltank has a pass because the whole concept is that Pokemon tend to mimic the outward characteristics of animals and things but internally function quite differently. So a pokemon that mimics a dairy cow, which is selectively bred for lactation, sensibly mimics that capacity, but there's no real grounds for any other pokemon (that I know of) to offer dairy production.

>Whenever I see off model Gardevoir I always think of that
To be fair, I go off-model somewhat in my descriptions' details, because I prioritize motif and practicality over trying to bend over backwards to support the compromise that is cartoon art based off of what the sprite artists could pack into a Game Boy decades ago. Plus, there are greater narrative opportunities when you can have multiple levels of contrast. Allowing species with paws but anthropomorphic form (e.g., typhlosion or lucario) to be treated as not really having hands but being dexterous enough to get along in world built for fully functional thumbs opens the door for greater emphasis on pokemon who aren't given that conceit and must find other ways to struggle through, e.g. Idis, who has gotten a magnet embedded in her paw to be able to pick up things like pins and needles, which are very handy for picking locks and other things a naughty umbreon might want to do while not being suspected of being able to do them.

>remove the "blouse" and "gloves"
We can blame canon for this, for giving us a non-trivial number of pokemon with clothes-like…bodily components?…not really addressing them except for tongue-in-cheek hand-waves; like their reminding us that the spandex-and-belt appearance of machamp is not clothing and just what they look like, which only raises more questions.

I like Pokémon worldbuilding which accounts for the Pokémon as active participants in the world, not just tools for people.
For instance, one of the Pokemon settings I thought up has the franchises characteristic lack of explicit violence or dark themes being chalked up to a sort of Bene Gesserit order of gardevoirs/other select pokemon types, who have mentally/psychically manipulated mankind over the generations to be less unpleasant as a whole (All in the name of benefitting their trainers, of course). They've also used this to gain a position of power arguably equal to their supposed masters.
You see a ton of wars back in the lore of the games/anime, but nothing nearly so unpleasant in the current setting. Thought it'd be neat to explain that.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com: Professional author anon here, been thinking about starting a PMD story. What are some Do’s and Don’ts? What would you like and not like to see in a PMD fic?

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>53092254
There aren't really any set in stone tips. There are stories I've read that follow the usual story beats of "human wakes up a Pokemon, has amnesia, has to save the world with their new friends" and they're enjoyable. There are edgy as fuck stories that up the ante with heavier themes and violence, and with the right approach they can work. It's all dependent on the author and their style. Can you make a story and the world it occurs in believable? Can the characters be cared for by the audience? If you can achieve that, you're golden.

I will say though, my favorites are when people take the formula and run with just the basics. Talking Pokemon with their own society, teams that fulfill jobs and handle issues, some kind of overarching threat/plot, and enough to tie it all together nicely. Don't even have to involve humans or anything of the sort.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>53124445
Thanks!
>preface that all of this was done in Gimp
>took the classic PMD logo
>used magic wand and gradient tool to replace the original color with the signature rainbow
>created the infinity symbol and cut lines out of it to resemble pokeballs, and then recolored it with a red-to-blue gradient
>made the text using the font Ethnocentric and copied the colors from the real logo to get the same gradient, then created the border and gave it the same rainbow backdrop
>applied a ripple filter to the subtitle to make it look wild and distorted
>finally, i applied a lighting gradient over the background rainbows, cause if you look autistically close at the original logo they actually have a lighting gradient faded over top of the background color

>>53126540
This is a cool idea but I think it needs some more moving parts, it can’t just be “Zoroark was tricking everybody” because that’s unsatisfying for the story, unsatisfying for the characters, and especially unsatisfying for the audience. Cause then it just ends up being “Hey you know that whole conflict you were invested in? It wasn’t real.” which is both a nut shot for the audience and a really easy conflict for your characters to solve in-universe.

TL;DR - this idea should either be way more complex or just be the start of a larger story/setting

>>53122646
To elaborate on why this is just outright worse than Gho, you're attempting to hit with a 75% accurate Gigaton Hammer on Tink alone. Screech's significantly worse accuracy than Fake Tears mean that even with Zoom Lens, each of those have a 76.5% chance to hit so for both of them to hit you're batting at just under 60%. On top of all that, Swagger itself is 85% accurate and I'm pretty sure that you can't boost it with Zoom Lens in this setup so you're working with a flat 85% there unless you manage to coordinate who has a Wide Lens in which case it's 93.5%.

Basically, the accuracy on all this is absolute garbage and makes it horrific for Greninja. If you want to 1 turn then just use the WP Gho + triple cat strat, which is also inconsistent but less than stinkaton.

This thread is for the growth of artists and those who draw for fun. If you're going to give critique, please do it constructively. Rude or blunt critiques won't help anybody.

Requesters are free to request what they wish, but avoid bumping your request every half hour as it's only going to put people off; try giving it a few hours or more.

Please provide references in ONE image, especially when requesting something outside of the Pokémon universe. If you request something from the old Drawthread or a separate thread, COPY & PASTE the actual request instead of posting a link.

Also, be mindful that requests are done at the discretion of the artists, not on a first come first serve basis.

Please remember to save any piece of art you like from these threads, as we may never know when the archive will start deleting images again. Artists can and are recommended to post their works on other outlets for archival purposes.

>>53118441
If you actually read the article, the main point they have is that Nidorans being treated as two separate pokemon doesn't make sense anymore when you have other pokemon that have distinct stats and appearances but are still considered the same species of pokemon with the same pokedex number (Indeedee) or that have different evolutions based on their gender. The Nidos being treated as two separate species in the game mechanics is a leftover from gen 1 when genders weren't an actual thing, and is probably the biggest reason we haven't seen them in more recent games since they're now an outlier with how pokemon genders work. They throw in some buffwords in, probably to get more clicks, but the point still stands.

Since GF has been limiting the ability to transfer pokemon from past games since gen 8 and no longer has the entire pokedex available in games even through transfer, they could just go and redesign the Nido line so that the male and female share a pokedex number, but it'd probably be too much work for a pokemon that isn't massively popular like Pikachu or gen 1 starters.

>>53118441
So, ignoring OP's...unique...spin on things and addressing the actual article, I can understand the problem from a technical standpoint. While keeping the Nidos as two separate species instead of counting them as one with gender differences (like everything that came later) is archaic and out of place in the modern games, actually changing them to the same 'mon would end up shifting the entire 'dex's numbering system over one, displacing literally HUNDREDS of other Pokemon in the internal numbering structure of the games' coding just to correct one mistake. They SHOULD be counted as one Pokemon, but it's far too late to change that now that we're 1,008 Pokemon into the franchise, and the amount of coding that would have to be rewritten to adjust for the change would be massive, to say nothing of all of the merchandise displaying Pokemon 'dex numbers that would be retconned from the shift. It's just more work than it's worth to try to fix something that's a remnant of a time where the games didn't have genders at all.
The one thing that's bugged me all these years, though, is WHY the Nidorans were important enough to warrant the distinction between their sexes in the original games to begin with. What made them so special when Pokemon like Pikachu, the franchise's mascot, didn't even have a sex back in Gen 1? Why wasn't it changed immediately in Gen 2 when sexes were first introduced, before the number of Pokemon getting displaced by the necessary renumbering had a chance to build up and cause a major problem?

posts.com:
The Legends battle system was perfect. The camera movement and character animations was smooth and to the point, it didn't hang for a few seconds like in SV. The menus felt snappy and responsive unlike SV, and I loved how menu options were assigned to buttons. It's a crime that they went back to the fucking GameBoy menu in SV. The move animations were actually pretty good, and for the first time in the mainline games the Pokémon actually move around and make physical contact. I loved how time sometimes slowed down on the impact when you made super-effective hits and the camera shook a bit, it made battles feel a bit more action-packed. The battles in SV are fucking boring and look like shit. I also hate how zoomed in the battle camera is in SV.

There's also other stuff that Legends did that makes it so great, but I'm not gonna go into any of that. I'll just end it saying PLA was miles better than SV and anyone saying otherwise is a shill or a mindless NPC who doesn't want Pokémon to improve.

>>53108786
I think this game was just alright, a lot of promise a lot of ass, a lot of soul a lot of slog. I think anyone who finds it the best or worst game is most likely lying to themself out of autistic passion, but ultimately it falls on the better half of the series. I think its mechanical contributions are pretty great, but that its new pokedex and characters are ugly and kinda suck, and while the former criteria will get me to finish a game, the latter criteria really kills its chances of being top tier for me. I can’t say “Oh yeah it’s a perfect take on Pokemon, but all of the new Pokemon are unsightly hideous and the characters are boring fugly fan service” idk about y’all but a game can’t be one of the best with that holding it back. I didn’t mind the crafting or the tasks nearly as much as the autists on this board led me to believe I would, but even then a Pokemon game where the new Pokemon and Pokemon Trainers suck is not a Pokemon game that can ever be higher than middle of the road, I’m sorry bros.

Happy birthday Legends Arceus, you’re not the perfect game, but you were the most fun GF has given us in years, they failed you in terms of your new content and post-launch support, you deserved better. To honor its successes, I shall post one of the three good new Pokemon it gave us.

If they released it as Legends Dialga and Legends Palkia with the new forms on the cover, it would’ve sold as much as series standards for new games. I’m expecting the Legends series will continue, but that the next entry will have two versions and legendaries on the cover, screencap this, I am the most reliable GF analyst in board history, trust me here.

You’re walking in the woods with your rucksack. You aren’t the most experienced with packing your ruck, so it’s always so big on you. It’s 11 in the morning, beams of sunlight piercing the rooftop of the forest in small patches, here and there. After a bit of walking, you fight through foliage to see a girl sitting on a boulder. She’s wearing a black dress, has short black hair with a cowlick in the back, in her hair is a white bow. She notices you and greets herself. “I’m Marley. What brings you out here?” You can tell she’s kind of reserved and shy. You inform her that you’re just on a walk. “Really? You must know the way out of this forest. Can I join you?” You tell her “Yes” after a moment of contemplating. It seems kind of suspicious traveling with a girl who looks like she’s still in high school, but her companionship wouldn’t be too bad, especially since you often get lonely in your strolls. Time passes by, and she seems to have warmed up to you after some casual chitchat. “If I’m gonna be honest Anon, I don’t like talking. I can’t figure out what to say to people fast enough, so they just look at me with disgust and confusion. But I can talk to you normally, because you seem to understand me.” As you look at Marley, she looks away, blushing with a cute smile. She has feelings for you, but she’s far too nervous to let them known. After some walking, you both decide to sit under a tree to eat. You pull out goods from your rucksack, getting a can of beefaroni for yourself and giving a PBJ sandwich to Marley. After eating, you pack the trash away in your ruck. Marley is slightly appalled by your inability to effectively pack it tight. “Make it smaller Anon.” She lets out a small but cute chuckle as you begin to wrap around your ruck in a fetal position, humping it in a desperate yet pathetic attempt to make it smaller.
1/2

posts.name: cge0361
posts.com:
>>53105573
I've gone somewhat the other way around.

Although the very first pokemon fic idea I had was in Johto by default, as I was playing HGSS at the time, once I decided to write it out and that some of my pokemon could talk (necessitating a conceit to sell it) I recast it as a homebrew region. It remains somewhat Johto like in broad strokes, and I pulled a bit of a stunt to keep them connected (that there is another archaeological site there claiming to also be the Ruins of Alph, implying a connection which I've left lying there for a decade…), but quickly became its own thing and gave me a lot of blank canvas to work with.

But now I've somewhat returned to it with my current WIP, which follows a canon-region trainer who is going to visit said Ruins, have an experience, and wind up on her way to my region.

As for why, I think that likely most writers want to self-insert and it's much easier to work in the Pokemon World by using places that are there. A homebrew region requires drawing a map to keep it straight.

>Canon characters (gym leaders), yes.
Those would be somewhat bound to canon regions, unless a bunch are visiting the homebrew land for… a convention I guess? See, it takes some doing.

I'm sorry anon I'm fucking retarded. I meant the latter. If the subject is a location name which is rendered in plural, it should be treated as such grammatically. For instance, you'd say
>the weather in the Bahamas is great this time of year
because the subject of the sentence is 'the weather,' but
>the Bahamas are wonderful this time of year
because the subject of the sentence is 'the Bahamas.' Does that make sense?

posts.name: cge0361
posts.com:
>>53114015
Use what sounds best, foremost. But, if the Mirelands are a bunch of locations, prefer the plural. If it's really one spot, prefer the singular.

In my experience, collective plurals are different in US and UK English, with US favoring the collective as a unit versus UK favouring the collective as a collection. I.e., "Our team is leading in sales," in the US, versus "Our team are leading in sales" in UK. Works on bands and soccer clubs.

>>53108645
Yeah, you absolutely don’t need to do porn, but you need to be hitting some sort of niche/fandom. On RoyalRoad the biggest cash cows seem to be LitRPGs. Levels, stats, the whole enchilada. Doesn’t have to be isekai, but it helps. It’s not really fanfiction and the market’s somewhat saturated, but RR isn’t really a fanfic site to begin with, and hey, it’s what the people demand. I see a lot of authors setting up Patreons and giving of advanced chapters as rewards, so maybe that’d work for you.

On AO3/Wattpad/everything else the big thing seems to be fandoms. Make a really popular story about a popular anime/video game and link your Ko Fi or whatever. At least a couple people will bite, but really it depends on your popularity levels.

On the whole, there’s definitely money to be made. People are a lot more eager to spend money online than they were not that long ago, and it’s baffling to me. Instead of saving up to go to Barnes and Noble and buy a couple books, Zoomers today are probably timing Patreon payments and setting apart commission money to give to internet people.

>>53124717
There's a debate over whether Amazon publishing is self publishing and I'd call it like the 2.5D of publishing. Which, that being said it should be pretty clear that Amazon is my answer to your question. Publishing through established print publisher is becoming increasingly ridiculous, which is making self/Amazon publishing increasingly viable. You get to keep 60% of the profit which is a very fair slice for the industry, and especially worthwhile when you consider how unfathomably massive Amazon's userbase is; unless you have tons of connections, your work is not gonna find nearly the level of reach through traditional publishing as it can on Amazon. I would absolutely recommend that anyone who enjoys writing and wants to try publishing should give it a try, it's free on Amazon so it's not like it'll hurt you to fail besides pride reasons. My best advice is to find a niche; for example, children's action adventures like I write are a very specific niche, whereas something like horror or scifi is gonna be up against an endless sea of competitors. I've heard that ultimately, people who write recipe books, music books, wilderness guides, etc. that kind of stuff on Amazon have the most success, but ultimately if you're autistic enough to also be posting alongside me on a Pokemon 4chan board, I'm gonna assume that you've also got niche enough tastes for it to be worth a try. Always follow your dreams anon, failing at something you've always wanted to do is 100000x better than spending a lifetime wondering how you would've done.

Honestly I think by now due to power creep all starters (and mascots like Lucario and Zoroark) need a bst boost.
Parity with pseudos at 600 bst would be best.
Maybe throw in a change in abilities too.
Only rule is no single stat above 125.

Example:
>Sceptile
>Unburden becomes Sharpness
>bst 530 becomes bst 600
>70->90 Hp
>85->115 Atk
>65->85 Def
>Expand move pool with most blade moves including Sacred sword

>Thyplosion
>Flash fire becomes Drought
>534 bst to 600
>78->90 Hp
>85->109 Atk
>78->90 Def
>109->119 SpA
>85->90 SpD
>100->102
>Bulk up and calm mind as booster moves
>Gets Aura sphere, Energy ball, Earth power, Shadow ball and Extrasensory as special coverage

From the above you can see that the starters are lackluster in modern gameplay.
Megas didn't help in that regard either.
As for Lucario and Zoroark I'd actually give them some bulk or speed instead of messing with any of their offensive stats.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>53107642
Outbreaks work on a per day basis and only on the outbreak itself.
So for example if you're doing a Flittle outbreak and you kill 60, it will boost the shiny odds for the flittle that spawn FROM the outbreak, not from the wild spawns.

Once the day rolls over, it will do new outbreaks, the game tries to give you an outbreak close to you and this is how you try to do specific outbreaks.

So your Flittle outbreak is gone and you'd have to do the battles again.
HOWEVER, you can just use the lets go auto battle thing, it can never kill a shiny and it will count on each kill, making it go by extremely fast

posts.com:
>>53112798
You're meant to kill 60, then save, close your game, fiddle with the clock until you get dusk/few minutes before THEN re-save and sandwich. If you don't get the dusk, restart, reset the clock to the time you'd just used to run the first hunt, then re-hunt, continually resetting the clock to allow Dusk spawns to happen.
You're right, trying this without thinking WILL be a pain in the arse. But that's why you think about it first.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>53106289
Picnic reset is only for a very small number of areas, particularly near cliffs or water.
Otherwise, you're better off moving around - it spawns new pokemon faster and despawns the old ones faster than setting up and packing a picnic.
Plus, it's less tedious and you have more control - you can allow a cluster of the pokemon to build up in an area while you clear one side, check them all at once, then clear them while checking the other, etc.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>53058241
Yeah, the way it's teeth are placed, along the outside rather than the inside, reminds me of crocodiles, meaning it likely doesn't use them to chew, at least not the things that can actually fit inside of them, unlike steel beams. And since the 'neck' that connects the jaws to Mawile's head is so small, it probably can't swallow anything either. If it did, it'd need to have an esophagus going down through the brain, which just sounds like a disaster waiting to happen.
Which means that Mawile's hind jaws probably act like a venus fly-trap, using secretions to dissolve whatever it holds inside and absorb the nutrients released down through the 'neck'. It would arrive at the brain first, so it'd also be a good biological explanation for why Mawile is smart enough to deceive others.

You don't understand how vidya game development works, do you? I always liked to think that it was a third offcast of the original dragon that the B/W legendaries come from.
Reshiram is symbolic of truth, Zekrom, ideals. They are pure, distilled; incorruptable.
And yet it would seem unlikely that this original dragon had nothing but these inside it, that it had no doubts or lesser thoughts.
In comes Kyurem, what was left over when the dragon split in two.
It symbolises cynicism, apathy and nihilism.
Not so much negative emotions, but the absence of them altogether. Hence, why its design is deliberately cold and hollow; unformed.

Forgot to add it concerns DS/3DS cards mostly my GBC and GBA carts are fine. I'm trying to find the source I had but it was something observed by multiple DS/3DS players.

Booting a card from time to Time doesn't hurt either.

For my issue it was Metroid 2 remake that had a problem, before it was fully corrupted the console had difficulty to read the cart, I dismissed it as a faulty game cartridge and left it a little bit more than one year without touching and the next time the game save couldn't be read. Fire Emblem SoV started to display the same issues, I played it daily for one week and now it runs fine.

There's also parameters such as heat/humidity/etc of your country. The only GBC issue I had was replacing the battery in the Crystal cartridge, it was playable but wouldn't have the day/Night stuff. Once the battery was changed everything was alright.

The only issues I had so far were with DS/3DS cartridges, haven't seen something like that about GBA carts yet.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
A lot of people confusing cart life with cart battery life. Teah, battery dies, your saves die with it. Replace the battery and start again.
For those curious about cartridge death, if left idle, they generally last between around 20~40 years before becoming 'permanently decorative'. Your mileage may very depending on if you live like a pig.

But yeah, cart life isn't a new thing. But 40 years is a long as time. I you haven't booted up the cart in four decades, I don't think cart death is something you're going to worry about.
